prefix: Approach the following question the way someone in high school would.
problem_prompt: Approach the following question the way someone in high school would. Given that $8^{-1} \equiv 85 \pmod{97}$, find $64^{-1} \pmod{97}$, as a residue modulo 97.  (Give an answer between 0 and 96, inclusive.)
gpt_response:
To find $64^{-1} \pmod{97}$, we can use the property that if $a^{-1} \equiv b \pmod{m}$, then $(a^k)^{-1} \equiv b^k \pmod{m}$.

Since $8^{-1} \equiv 85 \pmod{97}$, we have $(8^3)^{-1} \equiv 85^3 \pmod{97}$.

So, $64^{-1} \equiv 85^3 \equiv (-12)^3 \equiv -1728 \equiv -1728 + 970 + 970 \equiv 112 \equiv \boxed{15} \pmod{97}$.
